text: Pro-Trump conservatives go on offense to declare victory, arguing the president is vindicated by the lack of additional indictments from Special Counsel Mueller, even while the content of his report remains a mystery.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Isakson said if his kids ever spoke disparagingly about John McCain or questioned whether someone captured in combat is really a war hero, he would have a "serious conversation" with them.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Asked if President Trump is a role model, Sen. Isakson tells Bill Nigut of Political Rewind that "it's a damaging situation" and draws a comparison to Bill Clinton's scandalous behavior in Oval Office.
author: alexanderbolton

text: There are doubts in Kentucky about whether Amy McGrath, whom Chuck Schumer has encouraged to run for the Senate, has any chance at beating Mitch McConnell.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Twelve senators from different corners of the Republican Party band together to defy President Trump on core issue of separation of powers.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Tillis, explaining his decision to vote against disapproval resolution, says on Senate floor: "We have to recognize that we have a crisis at the border. 76,000 people crossing illegally in February alone. We have narcotics flooding our country."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Wow - Tillis flips and says he won't vote for resolution of disapproval.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump faces major GOP backlash on emergency border declaration, with 10 GOP senators saying they will back disapproval resolution — a number that may climb to 13 or higher.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Rob Portman on Senate floor argues that Trump doesn't need a national emergency to build a border wall and that making the emergency declaration sets a "dangerous precedent." Says he will support disapproval resolution.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Dick Durbin says the vote on disapproval resolution set for 2:15 pm - some time could be yielded back
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Lamar Alexander says off the Senate floor he will vote for the disapproval resolution.
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell chokes up with tears talking about Stew's years of dedication and work ethic in his leadership office. Stew, sitting behind him, looks uncomfortable.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mitch McConnell paying tribute on the Senate floor to deputy chief of staff Don Stewart: "There was Cher, there was Prince, there was Madonna and there's Stew. Everybody knows Stew."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Update from leadership staff: no time agreement yet on when Senate will vote on disapproval resolution. Not expected before lunchtime.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Mike Lee (R-Utah) says he will vote for the disapproval resolution: “We tried to cut a deal, the President didn’t appear interested.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Commerce Chair Roger Wicker says he hasn't talked to FAA or NTSB today about safety of Boeing 737 MAX but says it's a "good result" black-box recorders are at (or on way) to a lab in UK for analysis. "We're going to know what the data are soon," he said.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate GOP Whip John Thune says he would be "really surprised" if there are the votes to defeat the disapproval resolution, even if Trump endorses Mike Lee's National Emergencies Act reform bill.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mike Pence will relay offer to Trump whereby GOP senators kill disapproval measure & get national emergency reform.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Lindsey Graham: Pelosi smart to back off impeachment: “It would be divisive & politically be dangerous for them,  not good for the country.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Dick Durban (D-Ill.) says Boeing 737 MAX 8 planes shouldn’t be grounded without evidence showing safety problem. Boeing HQ in Chicago.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Democrats are less unified on tax policy than they were in 2012, the last time it figured prominently ahead of a presidential race. Elizabeth Warren, Bernie Sanders, Kamala Harris and AOC are setting the tone — but the broader party hasn't yet bought in.
author: alexanderbolton

text: "Much of the activity on Capitol Hill these days is more akin to trolling on Twitter than tackling national priorities."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.), who is concerned about President Trump infringing on Congress's spending power with emergency border declaration, now says he will NOT vote for House disapproval resolution, calling it "a show vote" that will be vetoed.
author: alexanderbolton

text: GOP senators say as many as 15 colleagues could defect on the resolution disapproving of Trump's emergency border declaration. They want him to take the money already at his disposal instead of emergency funds.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Asked if Sherrod Brown is "likable enough" as a White House candidate because of his sometimes unpolished appearance, Sen. Dick Durbin says of course, even though he adds "I don't think Sherrod has ever seen a copy of GQ let alone subscribe to it."
author: alexanderbolton

text:
Umm... the top tax rate in 1974 was 70 percent on income over $100,000. So AoC's current-day top-bracket proposal might have been considered centrist or even center-right at the time. 

https://www.tax-brackets.org/federaltaxtable/1974 …
author: alexanderbolton

text: Monday is kind of like an off campus day in the Senate.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Rand Paul at presser says he thinks at least 10 GOP senators will vote for disapproval resolution on emergency declaration.
author: alexanderbolton

text: After Trump’s comments on Warmbier, @senrobportman warns “we can’t be naive about what they did to Otto.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: .@senrobportman on Senate floor says “we can never forget about Otto” Warmbier, who died in North Korean custody. Says it’s “unforgivable.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Are we ready to elect a president who rides a hipster single speed?
author: alexanderbolton

text: Leader McConnell says debate over Trump’s emergency declaration dominated Tuesday lunch with Pence, says he’s not sure whether it’s legal.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Leader McConnell hits Dems for possibly dodging on Green New Deal by voting present and promises a vote before the August recess.
author: alexanderbolton

text: John Cornyn: “I’ll vote against the resolution of disapproval.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Meanwhile, Congress puts $8B in emergency contingency funding for State in deal. Doesn’t count against budget caps.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Richard Shelby and Nita Lowey realized the more junior members of the Senate-House conference - like Lucille Roybal-Allard who pushed ICE beds cap - had become a distraction in the border negotiations. When they limited the talks, the deal got done:
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sometimes as many as three officers would escort a senator through the subway area, making it difficult to ask a question or hear an answer without bumping into an officer or a fellow member of the press. Felt like the officers were trying to shield lawmakers from questions.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Nancy Pelosi sees Trump paving the way for a Democratic president declaring a national emergency on guns.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine) says Trump’s emergency declaration on border wall is of “dubious constitutionality” and will be fought in court
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell says President Trump will sign the border security funding/approps bill and will also declare a national emergency to get more funding. McConnell says he will support national emergency declaration.
author: alexanderbolton

text: GOP aide on support for appropriators’ border deal: “We need a signal from the White House soon or this could deteriorate rapidly.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. John Cornyn on border deal: “I think it’s a compromise, which means everybody is unhappy.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Former Rep. Walter Jones (R-N.C.), 76, a GOP critic of Iraq War, has passed away. His office: "He was a champion for our men and women in uniform and their families, always mindful of their service and sacrifice." As he always told reporters after interviews, "God Bless."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Perdue argued in a recent meeting with Senate GOP colleagues that they shouldn't waste 14 weeks passing a budget that won't balance in 10 years. Instead, he says, appropriators should get top-line numbers and chamber should focus on budget reform.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Kay Granger, asked if a border deal can be reached by Friday, says “no” and cites “just the time” although believes talks on right track.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Fed Chair Jerome Powell spotted walking into McConnell’s office after dining with Trump Monday.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump appears a lock to win the GOP nomination in 2020 but still some Republican senator aren't ready to endorse him. Looming Mueller report is one of several uncertainties confronting the president over the next 18 months.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Amy Klobuchar, the thinking person's candidate for president in 2020, according to George Will.
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell will be announcing members of the border security/gov’t funding conference in about an hour, per GOP aide.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Portman, somewhat tongue in cheek: “You derailed the talks twice and then in the end you brought [them] back. So Sen. Everett, right?”
author: alexanderbolton

text: .@senrobportman credits @burgessev story on mods letter leading to shutdown deal: “If you hadn’t published the letter, we wouldn’t be here.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: GOP senators, including Leader McConnell, tell Vice President Pence at lunch that the shutdown is not smart political strategy and needs to end as soon as possible, per sources.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Cory Booker escapes ethics sanction over his ‘I am Spartacus’ moment.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Rick Scott says he will not vote for Schumer proposal to open government until Feb. 8. He says he wants “a permanent solution.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Massive pro-life crowd marching past the Capitol.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Chuck Schumer is recruiting Rep. Ruben Gallego (D-Ariz.), a rising star in the House, to run for John McCain's Senate seat. Gallego will be announcing his decision soon. w/ @scottwongDC
author: alexanderbolton

text: “Oh my god, this is your life!” Rep. Veronica Escobar exclaims to @AOC as they walk through blizzard of camera clicks to McConnell’s office.
author: alexanderbolton

text: After delivering letter to McConnell staffer Don Stewart and huddling with colleagues, AOC promolty walks back into GOP leader’s office.
author: alexanderbolton

text: AOC huddling with colleagues after delivering letter to Mitch McConnell’s office urging him to vote on bills reopening government.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Tim Scott: “If the government is not operating then the reality of it is that we ought not to be voting on anything at this point.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Jeanne Shaheen on Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez: “Her views don’t represent a lot of my constituents.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Tim Kaine has told Mitch McConnell that he will object to the Senate adjourning while the government is shut down.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Graham tells reporters that Senate talks on finding immigration compromise have fallen apart: “I see no path forward.” Plans to go to gym.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Asked whether Congress might override Trump veto of bill to reopen government, Richard Shelby says, “that won’t happen.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Joe Manchin says he hasn't yet seen the framework set out by Lindsey Graham to end the shutdown, a combination of border wall funding with sweeteners for Democrats.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Group of moderate Senate Republicans think they can add sweeteners to funding for Trump's border wall to pick up Democratic votes.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Marco Rubio says that GOP senators “expressed concern about the impact [the shutdown] is having on federal workers” at Trump meeting.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Dem Leader Chuck Schumer at event with furloughed federal workers: "We all want border security" and pledges to work on issue once government is open.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Reporter asks why Mitch McConnell is not at Rose Garden press conference. Trump answers: "Because he's running the Senate."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump says he has the power to declare a national emergency to spend money to build the border wall and may do so.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump, asked at White House presser about possible impeachment, tells reporters: "You can't impeach someone doing a great job."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate adjourns until 3 pm Tuesday.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mitch McConnell says Senate will move soon — while gov shutdown talks continue — on package of bills related to Middle East policy introduced by Sen. Marco Rubio, bolstering Israel alliance and sanctioning Syria.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Cory Gardner: “We should pass a continuing resolution to get the government back open.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Re @realDonaldTrump. I asked Sen. Jeff Flake before Christmas if he was interested in hosting his own cable TV program and he said he wasn't. He said he would probably explore serving on corporate boards and exploring other opportunities.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump doubles down on $5.6 billion for border wall/fence/slats during televised remarks at White House Cabinet meeting, brushing aside GOP senators' proposals for compromise. Tack another week onto the shutdown? Trump says "could be a long time"
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Dem Whip Dick Durbin signals on Meet the Press he is likely to run for re-election in 2020, despite speculation to the contrary: "I"m raising money and trying to lose weight." Says that's usually an indication a pol is running for re-election.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Democratic aide says Sen. Flake is about to flip his vote to 'yes' on motion to proceed to House border bill. Waiting to hear on "agreement" between McConnell and Schumer.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Bob Corker says McConnell and Schumer will soon announce an agreement on how to proceed on House border bill, could lead to broader deal.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Feinstein is coming back to the Capitol, per an aide. Jones is here.
author: alexanderbolton

text: It isn’t real until they break out the talking stick.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Only 5 Dems on the Appropriations panel voted against $1.6 billion for border fencing in June: Feinstein, Durbin, Udall, Merkley, and Schatz
author: alexanderbolton

text: A few senators are pushing a last-minute attempt to reauthorize the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program in exchange for border wall funding.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Motion to proceed to House-passed border bill is losing on the Senate floor at the moment, 36 to 43. No sign of Mike Pence.
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell says talks with President Trump will continue this afternoon and he will start Senate proceedings on House border wall bill.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Bob Corker says Republicans might have trouble trusting Trump after U-turn on shutdown: “This is a juvenile place we find ourselves.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Rep. Jim Clyburn (D-S.C.) on MSNBC warns holiday travelers that TSA personnel could be cranky next week as they will be working without pay.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Is the House going to take another five-day recess?
author: alexanderbolton

text: Chuck Schumer at presser: “President Trump is plunging the country into chaos.” Cites stock market drops, Jim Mattis resignation, shutdown.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate is adjourning, will reconvene at noon Friday for possible vote on any spending bill passed by the House.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska) tells @frankthorp and me: "I would just remind the president, the Republicans are in charge and so the shutdown is on us if we can't figure this out. That's not good governance."
author: alexanderbolton

text: GOP senators also expressed concern to Pence about Trump’s claim that ISIS has been defeated. Some GOP lawmakers disagree with assessment.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Lindsey Graham says GOP senators told Vice President Pence at lunch they did not appreciate being blindsided on Syria announcement.
author: alexanderbolton

text: The group Demand Justice has an ad placed in tomorrow's Des Moines Register urging Senate Democrats with 2020 ambitions to "make no more deals on Trump judges." Add features Klobuchar, Sanders, Booker, Warren, Gillibrand, Harris and others.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Democratic aide says Schumer will not agree to judges package.  This comes after GOP blew up the Senate’s blue-slip tradition.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mitch McConnell says he will move a continuing resolution lasting until February, signaling a breakdown in negotiations with Democrats on border security and a larger package.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Majority Leader McConnell says he and Schumer "will be talking about trying to put together some kind of package on both executive branch nominations and judicial nominations" for the end of the week.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Schumer says Democrats would seriously consider a short-term stop gap funding government if offered by GOP leaders.
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell says Leader Pelosi has “little latitude” to deal on border security and spending because of her upcoming Speaker’s election.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. McConnell says the president is “extremely flexible” on finding a deal on border security and year-end spending. He’s consulting w/ WH
author: alexanderbolton

text: Excellent analysis of the trade war with China and why it's so important for President Trump to get a win.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Schumer spokesman just informed me that "judges were neither mentioned nor discussed in the meeting" that McConnell, Schumer, Shelby and Leahy attended in McConnell's office Tuesday morning.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Richard Shelby (R-Ala.) after leaving a meeting with Mitch McConnell and Chuck Schumer says moving a package of judges could be part of year-end spending deal - but nothing's set yet.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump White House says its looking for other ways to fund the border wall but GOP senator says Republican and Democratic appropriators would have to sign off on reprograming funding.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. John Thune says there’s no real discussion of a Senate GOP backstop plan to avoid a shutdown and it’s up to Trump and the Democrats.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate GOP Whip John Cornyn says “there is no discernible plan” on how to avoid a shutdown and puts his hands up in the air.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Chuck Schumer chokes up on the Senate floor in farewell speech to Heidi Heitkamp.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Who gets the top of the ticket?
author: alexanderbolton

text: Schumer tells reporters that he was surprised by Trump’s shutdown threat at meeting: “No, we did not expect that to happen.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump blows up GOP messaging book on government shutdown, telling Schumer and Pelosi: "I am proud to shut down the government for border security, Chuck" ... "I will take the mantle. I will be the one to shut it down."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Trump in comments before meeting with Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi says he doesn't want to see a government shutdown but predicts he probably won't reach an agreement with Democratic leaders at today's meeting.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mitch McConnell says Senate will take up Criminal Justice Reform as soon as the end of this week and warns Senate may have to work between Christmas and New Year's to get everything done.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate GOP Whip John Cornyn says less than half Senate GOP conference supports criminal just reform bill as of last whip check, majority are opposed or undecided.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Beto O'Rourke has the Democratic base fired up but veterans on the Hill need to be convinced he's more than a "shiny new object."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Bob Corker says CIA director Gina Haspel will brief members of Foreign Relations and Armed Services on Khashoggi at 11 am tomorrow.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Democrats are digging in for a fight against "New NAFTA" deal: https://thehill.com/policy/finance/trade/419222-trumps-new-nafta-faces-uphill-battle-in-congress …
author: alexanderbolton

text: Jeff Flake says he will seek another vote on the special counsel protection bill next week.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. John Cornyn (R-Texas) says final vote on Thomas Farr will be postponed until next week because of the absence of Sen. Jim Inhofe for family-related reasons.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate Leader Mitch McConnell says GOP is discussing punishment for Saudi Arabia: “Some kind of response is going to be appropriate.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: Corker not pulling any punches on this.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.) calls for sanctions on Saudi Arabia after Trump's Khashoggi statement: "It is not in our national security interests to look the other way when it comes to the brutal murder of Mr. Jamal Khashoggi."
author: alexanderbolton

text: Grassley on criminal justice reform: “Seems to me the Senate majority leader ought to be helping the president get his program through.”
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell says once there is a final deal on criminal justice reform his team will whip it and decide if there’s time for vote in lame duck
author: alexanderbolton

text: Leader McConnell has announced Sen. Chuck Grassley as the Senate’s new President Pro Tem.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Joni Ernst elected vice chair of Senste GOP conference.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Chris Van Hollen says he’s not interested in another stint as DSCC chair.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Sen. Chuck Schumer on hearing news that Jeff Sessions has resigned: "Protecting Mueller and his investigation is paramount" and warns of "constitutional crisis" if Session's departure is a prelude to firing Mueller.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Chuck Schumer at press conference: "Last night was a really good night for Democrats," arguing "there is now a check on Donald Trump" and citing pick-up of 7 governorships.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Shortly after Mitch McConnell says he doesn't see Congress moving DACA legislation in lame duck or next year, President Trump tells reporters at the White House: "I think we could really do something having to do with DACA."
author: alexanderbolton

text: President Trump praises Mitch McConnell at White House press conference: "We actually have a great relationship but people just don't understand it."
author: alexanderbolton

text:
Asked about a possible DACA fix moving in the lame-duck session or next year, Mitch McConnell replies, "Oh my goodness." 

"I can't imagine with all the things we have to do here to wrap up this Congress that we would revisit immigration," he added.
author: alexanderbolton

text: McConnell says he’s already spoken to House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi and says infrastructure could be an area of common ground.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Leader McConnell says “it is indeed a good morning for Senate Republicans” and thanked President Trump for campaigning for GOP candidates.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Senate race in Montana tied 48.5 - 48.5 with 55 percent reporting. Tester doing well in Missoula and Cascade counties.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Mitch McConnell just called Trump to thank him for all the travel and campaigning he did on behalf of Senate GOP candidates, per ABC News. Trump delivered big for McConnell tonight, at least as things look now.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Must be a bad night for Dems if this was in doubt.
author: alexanderbolton

text:
Bill Nelson loss in Fla. huge victory for Trump. Per @pkcapitol, since '78 midterms, 23 incumbent senators have run for reelection from state a president from the other party had won two years earlier by single-digits.

Senate incumbent from the opposition won all 23 contests.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Democrats will focus on victories in gubernatorial races and what it means for redistricting after the 2020 census.
author: alexanderbolton

text: Thirty-four percent of North Dakotans in exit polling say that @SenatorHeitkamp 's vote against Brett Kavanaugh was "an important factor" in their vote. She got beaten by more than 10 points despite Democratic predictions that she would be underestimated.
author: alexanderbolton

text: More Bredesen criticism of Washington Dems on Supreme Court: “Coming out immediately against anyone who Trump put up was a mistake.”
author: alexanderbolton
